title: Arrays Summary & AI-Scope Wrap-Up

description.core_idea: This node consolidates all array concepts and defines the safe boundaries for AI interactions.
explanation: Arrays are contiguous blocks of fixed-size elements allowing predictable memory access.
Indexing allows direct computation of element addresses.
Random access and cache locality explain practical speed.
Traversal, insertion, deletion, and multi-dimensional access follow from these fundamentals.
Think-LIE can safely teach concepts within this scope and avoid topics like dynamic resizing or advanced optimizations.
key_points: Memory representation, contiguity, and indexing form the foundation
Random access and cache explain performance intuition
AI-scope defines what is safe to explain

examples: arr[5] is accessed directly using base_address + 5 * element_size
2D array arr[1][2] uses formula base + (1*row_size + 2) * size
common_misconceptions: Arrays are always faster than other data structures in every scenario
Memory layout is invisible to performance
